q: The time is now, the place is here. Stay in the present.
h:
“The time is now, the place is here. Stay in the present.” —
Dan Millman

q: Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness.
h:
“Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: The more people you help become successful the more successful you become.
h:
“The more people you help become successful the more successful you become.” —
Steve Harvey

q: By words the mind is winged.
h:
“By words the mind is winged.” —
Aristophanes

q: Stand up to your obstacles and do something about them. You'll find they haven't half the strength you think they have.
h:
“Stand up to your obstacles and do something about them. You'll find they haven't half the strength you think they have.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans.
h:
“If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans. ” —
Woody Allen

q: Truth is not something outside to be discovered, it is something inside to be realized.
h:
“Truth is not something outside to be discovered, it is something inside to be realized.” —
Osho

q: What the mind can conceive and believe, and the heart desire, you can achieve.
h:
“What the mind can conceive and believe, and the heart desire, you can achieve.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Listen to the secret sound, the real sound, which is inside you.
h:
“Listen to the secret sound, the real sound, which is inside you.” —
Kabir

q: Better to have, and not need, than to need, and not have.
h:
“Better to have, and not need, than to need, and not have.” —
Franz Kafka

q: Success is a poor teacher.
h:
“Success is a poor teacher.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: If anything is worth doing, do it with all your heart.
h:
“If anything is worth doing, do it with all your heart.” —
Buddha

q: Today will never happen again. Don't waste it with a false start or no start at all.
h:
“Today will never happen again. Don't waste it with a false start or no start at all.” —
Og Mandino

q: Who wishes to fight must first count the cost.
h:
“Who wishes to fight must first count the cost.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Lust, anger and greed are the three gates to self-destructive hell.
h:
“Lust, anger and greed are the three gates to self-destructive hell.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.
h:
“Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Values are like fingerprints. Nobody's are the same, but you leave 'em all over everything you do.
h:
“Values are like fingerprints. Nobody's are the same, but you leave 'em all over everything you do.” —
Elvis Presley

q: FEAR has two meanings: 'Forget Everything And Run' or 'Face Everything And Rise.' The choice is yours.
h:
“FEAR has two meanings: 'Forget Everything And Run' or 'Face Everything And Rise.' The choice is yours.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Don't let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
h:
“Don't let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.” —
John Wooden

q: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
h:
“A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.” —
Ayn Rand

q: If you go out looking for friends, you're going to find they are very scarce. If you go out to be a friend, you'll find them everywhere.
h:
“If you go out looking for friends, you're going to find they are very scarce. If you go out to be a friend, you'll find them everywhere.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Success is the progressive realization of a worthy goal or ideal.
h:
“Success is the progressive realization of a worthy goal or ideal.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: One never does wrong by doing right.
h:
“One never does wrong by doing right.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Words have no power to impress the mind without the exquisite horror of their reality.
h:
“Words have no power to impress the mind without the exquisite horror of their reality.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: The smallest of actions is always better than the noblest of intentions.
h:
“The smallest of actions is always better than the noblest of intentions.” —
Robin Sharma

q: The health of nations is more important than the wealth of nations.
h:
“The health of nations is more important than the wealth of nations.” —
Will Rogers

q: Don't allow your mind to tell your heart what to do. The mind gives up easily.
h:
“Don't allow your mind to tell your heart what to do. The mind gives up easily.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Falling down is not failure. Failure comes when you stay where you have fallen.
h:
“Falling down is not failure. Failure comes when you stay where you have fallen.” —
Socrates

q: Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves.
h:
“Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
h:
“The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.” —
Mark Twain

q: Stuff your eyes with wonder... live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.
h:
“Stuff your eyes with wonder... live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.” —
Ray Bradbury

q: The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you are likely to see.
h:
“The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you are likely to see.” —
Winston Churchill

q: The less you want, the richer you are. The more you need in order to be happy, the more miserable you'll be.
h:
“The less you want, the richer you are. The more you need in order to be happy, the more miserable you'll be.” —
Yanni

q: Nothing will work unless you do.
h:
“Nothing will work unless you do.” —
Maya Angelou

q: The ones who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones that do.
h:
“The ones who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones that do.” —
Steve Jobs

q: Always focus on the front windshield and not the rear view mirror.
h:
“Always focus on the front windshield and not the rear view mirror.” —
Colin Powell

q: Wisdom is the oneness of mind that guides and permeates all things.
h:
“Wisdom is the oneness of mind that guides and permeates all things.” —
Heraclitus

q: Honor is the foundation of courage.
h:
“Honor is the foundation of courage.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: You have the potential for greatness.
h:
“You have the potential for greatness.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
h:
“Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do. ” —
Voltaire

q: The danger of an adventure is worth a thousand days of ease and comfort.
h:
“The danger of an adventure is worth a thousand days of ease and comfort.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: When you win, say nothing, when you lose say less.
h:
“When you win, say nothing, when you lose say less.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: If you're walking down the right path and you're willing to keep walking, eventually you'll make progress.
h:
“If you're walking down the right path and you're willing to keep walking, eventually you'll make progress.” —
Barack Obama

q: Don't be afraid of missing opportunities. Behind every failure is an opportunity somebody wishes they had missed.
h:
“Don't be afraid of missing opportunities. Behind every failure is an opportunity somebody wishes they had missed.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey.
h:
“We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey.” —
Kenji Miyazawa

q: Love doesn't need reason. It speaks from the irrational wisdom of the heart.
h:
“Love doesn't need reason. It speaks from the irrational wisdom of the heart.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: One is never afraid of the unknown; one is afraid of the known coming to an end.
h:
“One is never afraid of the unknown; one is afraid of the known coming to an end.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies.
h:
“What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies.” —
Aristotle

q: Knowledge is a treasure, but practice is the key to it.
h:
“Knowledge is a treasure, but practice is the key to it.” —
Lao Tzu

q: To be of use to the world is the only way to be happy.
h:
“To be of use to the world is the only way to be happy.” —
Hans Christian Andersen
